reviewText: If you are just starting an exercise program or don't have enough time to exercise, this is a great DVD to start with, it gets your heart pumping with weights added in.  Years ago when I first started to do the older The Firm (VHS) and I couldn't finish one without stopping several times before I got to the end, it took awhile but I finally could do a whole tape.  This exercise DVD lets me finish to the end (YEAH!) without feeling too old and out of shape.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like this workout, however it doesn't work up as much of a sweat as some of the other firm workouts.  Its good if you want an easier workout. The last 20 min workout is cardio only and no weights are needed.  It has a little Latin feel and is fun.This DVD throws me though. Allie looks so different in this DVD compared to the later ones, I don't know if its the make up or what, but I took me a while to get used to it.  She says "pow" a lot through the workouts, can get a little old, but I like her energy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great cardio DVD. This is broken up into 20 minute workouts, even with just one workout you feel like you have done a complete workout. This arrived at a great time and in perfect condition.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a runner so I really value my knees and therefore avoid any at-home high-intensity workouts that involve a lot of jumps / plyometrics / excessive squats. These workouts were just too high-impact for me and the choreography moved too fast.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is definitely not one of the Firm's better workouts.  Allie has a great on-camera personality but I've always found the workouts she leads to be too easy and the workouts on this DVD are no exception.  I would recommend this workout for beginners rather than intermediate or advanced exercisers.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been doing the FIRM for many years and after I made the mistake of purchasing a recent FIRM which turned out to be disappointing, I took this one out of the library to try first.  I was impressed and will purchase shortly. Great, intense workout and it had some very different moves which will give my muscles the "muscle confusion" that it sorely needed after doing the same rotation of Firms for so many years.Instructor:  Allie is very chirpy and upbeat but not too chatty. Her cue-ing is pretty good but in the first workout, she pauses too long between workouts to describe the next set of movements.  Compared to other instructors, she is one of the better ones.Workout: split into 3 sections:1. Cardio and Sculpt - short, low impact workout. The instructor stopped between sets to describe the next move which I felt was waste of valuable time when you're trying to maintain the fat burning `zone'.  I would recommend this set for the Beginners because it was less intense and had lengthy descriptions of the movements. It had some great new movements I haven't seen before like the side lunge to the right, then shift weight to the left while pivoting and raising the right leg. Really felt this in the hip area.2. Fat Blasting Bursts - really got my heart pumping right away and had some great new moves.  Solid lower and upper body toning but since it doesn't provide the full 20 minutes of cardio, I combine with above.3. Dance-y Cardio - I skipped this part altogether because I found them to be too boring and I need to maximize my workout time by doing what I know will really elevate my heart rate and tone my muscles.I normally skip the warm up and cool down sections and to them on my own to save time and I started with Workout 2 to get my heart pumping then did some of Workout 1 to give myself the full 20+ minutes of cardio. Read years ago that it takes atleast 20 minutes of continuous cardio to go into the fat burning zone. I'm sure a shorter workout offers benefits as well but I always feel that if I don't commit to the full 20 minutes, I have pretty much wasted my workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I liked the workout, but the instructor moves way to fast changing steps and needs to do them more slowly to introduce them as they can be confusing moving at the fast pace of the workout.  I do like it and was able to complete the entire hour long workout at once even at age 64, just need more help on the more complcated steps.sue in ohio
summary: Need to slow down to intro steps
Title: N/A

reviewText: I purchased directly through the Firm's website during pre-order and received it in December 2011 which is why I can review it before it's retail release through amazon.com. I might have been able to get it before the general public, but I also spent twice what amazon has this listed for... DOH! :DAfter moving away from The Firm for other workouts over the recent years, I am finding myself coming back to my workout roots for a plethora of reasons and this DVD is just another reason why I am falling in love with The Firm all over again! This DVD has 3-20 minute routines and Allie is the lead instructor for each workout. A modifier is shown, usually the modification is sans weights, but they also show the low/lower impact version and a version of the exercise that has less intensity overall making it a nice workout for everyone, including beginners. This workout for me is exactly what The Firm Express should have been!!! The pace is not comfortably slow but it's not frantic either. It's a nice, steady, pace and the intensity can be bumped up further by increasing the weight or putting more effort into the intensity when and where needed. Another thing I like is that she not only tells you what is coming, she demos the low impact/intensity version of the exercise before going for the unmodified version. For example with Burpees. Instead of diving right into the burpee you do a runner's lunge. If you are beginner or choose to not do the full burpee, Rebekah modifies to keep doing the runner's lunge version instead. Again, comparing to Firm Express, the modified didn't do the best job modifing. On another note related to FE, if you want to give FE another try but want more modification, this new DVD shows you some great modifications that can easily adapt to the FE series. I might just give FE another try at some point bc of that alone.If you were someone that was turned off from The Firm when they began to release a lot of the Pinks, which is where I originally jumped ship (although I am now loving the Pinks) The strength work reminds me of earlier systems like the BSS1-4 series. The lifting is slower and more controlled with higher reps- no more 4-8 total reps done with 5 pounds that became popular with the Pinks. Like with FE, you pick up heavier dumbbells and will need 3 sets of weights. Because the pace is controlled, I found myself needing to bump up to a higher weight, making notes for the next workout. It's nice to see The Firm going back to a tried and true method of strength training! A huge benefit of the DVD I think!In Workout 1 the "cardio" varies from aerobics to cardio in the form of body weight exercises like reverse lunges and squats with kicks. You move from cardio to strength and repeat. There is no floor ab work here, instead you work the abs with the strength and you do standing ab towards the end of the workout. The strength work is slower and more controlled allowing you to really heavy up.Workout 2 is still cardio-strength however you will see many more compound exercises in this workout than in Workout 1. You will also combine a cardio movement with a strength movement for example moving the legs while doing triceps or biceps exercises. The pace is a little faster, although you will still need 3 sets of weights. I did find that I could still lift more with this workout than with Pinks- just to give a reference point for those that want one. The cardio is easy to follow and as always, the form of the instructors is amazing! Rebekah is the modifier in this workout as well. FYI- there are also burpees in this segment too but they are modified again with the runner's lunge. in addition to weight work, you will also get body weight exercises with the burpees, push ups and standing abs.Workout 3 I have not done because I am not a fan of The Firm Cardio-only in general but especially their dance workouts. This is a dance-inspired workout although the choreography seems easy to pick up. No weights are needed here and the pace is a little faster. I only previewed this workout so more details cannot be provided.A website is listed on the back cover so that the buyer can have access to the Free Online Bonus Workout that is 10 minutes long.All in all, I am very happy with my purchase. Allie is an amazing lead and the workout gives you something to look forward to with no dread factor. You can access each workout through the main screen and it includes a "Play All" option. There are previews at the beginning of the workout for other Gaiam and Firm workouts but I was able to skip through them with no issues. Pick one 20 minute routine or a combination to suite your needs and schedule. You will get the best of strength and cardio with this workout. The set is bright, the music is good compared to other Firm workouts, and the instruction and form are spot on! Great purchase and I am happy with it even though I spent more on it just to have it early.
summary: This is a Firm Workout to own!
Title: N/A
